<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.2 is: Functions shall not call themselves, either directly or indirectly.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of reply_with_method_not_supported:
```c
static enum MHD_Result
reply_with_method_not_supported (struct MHD_Connection *c)
{
  static const char page_content[] =
    "<html><head><title>Requested HTTP Method Is Not Supported</title></head>" \
    "<body>The requested HTTP method is not supported.</body></html>";
  static const size_t page_content_len =
    (sizeof(page_content) / sizeof(char)) - 1;
  struct MHD_Response *resp;
  enum MHD_Result ret;

  resp = MHD_create_response_from_buffer_static (page_content_len, page_content)
  ;
  if (NULL == resp)
    return MHD_NO;

  /* Ignore possible error when adding the header as the reply will work even
     without this header. */
  (void) MHD_add_response_header (resp,
                                  MHD_HTTP_HEADER_CONTENT_TYPE, "text/html");

  ret = MHD_queue_response (c, MHD_HTTP_NOT_IMPLEMENTED, resp);
  MHD_destroy_response (resp);
  return ret;
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: The remainder of the function consists of local declarations, static string/data definitions, a simple sizeof-based length computation, and return statements — none of these are function calls and therefore cannot create direct or indirect recursion. The function signature and local variable declarations do not invoke any callable behavior. The only code locations that could introduce indirect recursion are the explicit function calls listed above (creation, header addition, queuing, destruction); these should be investigated to determine whether any of those functions might (directly or indirectly) call reply_with_method_not_supported. No other fragments in this function can cause self-calls or indirect calls and thus do not need investigation for Rule 17.2.
